Reviews.Title: “Good, simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: we were here between 14 to 17 april, 2012. The rooms are small which is probably the norm in this area, but the location of the hotel was excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful. Had a good time. But apart from the accomodation, nothing else to do in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect combination of location, quality and price”
Reviews.Author: Petra3000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Faros hotel from 18th to 22nd of April 2012 (2 adults + 2 children). I must say, that all staff was very very friendly and helpful. Room was not very big, but big enough for four of us. Hotel was clean, breakfast had enough variety, also food in restaurant was great. Hotel is located on a really nice street with shops and restaurants (you should see locations and appearance of some other hotels, that according to description supposed to be high quality). Faros is on a walking distance to all major sights in Sultanahmet, we also walked all the way to Taksim. I was only affraid of noise at night, but it was not a problem at all. We made a reservation directly through their website and they provided free both way airport transfer for us. All together, one of our best hotel experiences ever!! Thank you, Faros hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous experience staying at the Faros Hotel. The staff were amazing, friendly, and helpful. Our room was very clean and nicely decorated. I would go back in a heartbeat. It was our best hotel experience in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good restaurant, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TurkeyFan1
Reviews.Content: The Faros hotel is well located for the tram and ferry cruises. The restaurant is good and seems to be popular with locals as well as visitors. The staff are friendly. The penthouse view is very nice. The room was on the small side. There is a lift, but there are two short flights of steps to get to it.

Reviews.Title: “Our "second home" in Istanbul...even in winter season!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Faros Hotel from 26 till 30 January 2012. It was our 4th time at this hotel. Before we have had some experience of staying at some others 4 stars hotels in Sultanahmet and Beyazit (close districts in Istanbul). Now I can definitely say Faros Hotel is the best and coziest hotel for us, we called him â€œour second homeâ€� and last 2 years stayed only there during our visits Istanbul. There was a very good special offer â€“ â€œstay 4 nights and pay only for 3â€� in winter after New Year until March. We used this opportunity and have got a very good price. This time everything was good as usual: very friendly and helpful staff; clean, light, warm and big room; rich breakfasts and nice lunches with 10% discount for Faros Hotel guests (Testi Kebab was really tasty :) I have read on TripAdvisor about problems with heating system in some rooms in February but we really had no problem with it. Our family room 203 was always warm during all our living, even if outside was snow storm every day. I do not know why but we had no shower gel in our bathroom on a first day. We asked at reception and got a new big bottle with a nice flower aroma (special for us :) â€“ personally thanks to Mr. ZÃ¼lkuf. Also I would like to thanks Mr. GÃ¼ven â€“ he helped us with on-line registration to our air flight through Internet on his computer. And of course the biggest gratitude to Hotel Manager Mr. Haluk Kilic â€“ he arranged for us a family room instead of standart room again (as for repeat guests) and free late check-out at 3 p.m. He was very polite as always and spent his time with us after our check-out until we left hotel using offered free transfer: Hotel â€“ AtatÃ¼rk International Airport (by the way transfer Airport â€“ Hotel was also free). We have had good time in Istanbul (even if the weather was unsettled) and are going to come back again in July - it will be our 5th time at Faros Hotel Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel - incomparable location and price”
Reviews.Author: RWorldtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is yet another extremely positive review for this fabulous boutique hotel in the heart of Istanbul's old city. My room looked exactly like the photos on the website - extremely modern and stylish and exceptionally clean. The staff treated me like an old friend and responded without hesitation to my questions and specific requests (such as a bathroom with a bathtub instead of merely a shower). They clearly aim to please. The hotel is steps away from Istanbul's key attractions - the Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace - and the tram to the new city and the Bosphorus runs right outside. I loved the quaint sound of the tram bell as it passed below my windows. That said, the windows, when closed, let in remarkably little noise. The Faros offered a free airport transfer included in the room price if you book through their website and how wonderful it was to see the driver patiently waiting for me when I exited Ataturk airport! While the location is incredibly convenient, it is in a bustling neighborhood filled with tourists, which is not for everyone. And do not expect an expansive lobby, suitable for lounging at the Faros. The hotel's uninteresting exterior and compact foyer on the ground floor belies the attractive, large, light-filled rooms that you will find above. A true bargain in a boom-economy city that is increasingly more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient location, good service and hospitable staff”
Reviews.Author: Azer_Dervish
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent a week-stay bearing in mind all what any traveller needs, i.e. acceptable accomodation price, easy to access location (tram/tube transport), friendly staff. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: stewardess79
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough nice things about the people who work at this hotel! They were all so amazing and helpful. The location is great and the restaurant in the hotel is great too! I can see why the Faros Hotel got so many great reviews. One thing though, if you do go in the winter, bring extra warm clothes to sleep in......the rooms are freezing!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: PM09
Reviews.Content: Like: * hotel restaurant very good * location is perfect, a short walk to the train and key sites eg Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar * reception staff very helpful * rooms are great Note: * do not stay on the 4th floor. Here, there is a door that goes up to the roof to look out over the city. The door is constantly slamming in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go winter time”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, but we booked our stay on feb 16th for 3 nights and we had to check out same night because there was no heating and we were freezing in the room! They told us there was a problem and offered us to bring a small heating device! We had to go! Rooms were nicely decorated but small, location although is excellent for tourist attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Dee028
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely clean, easy to access, modern hotel. Stayed in Istanbul for 4 nights, felt this hotel is just close enough to Taksim to access all forms of transport, yet tucked away enough not be be on its door step. Its a modern 'warehouse' feel kind of hotel. You can not hear anything from outside the hotel- great sound proofing, however we could hear what was going on in the hotel coridoors- we didnt mind though. We were not disturbed and our room was cleaned what ever time we left the hotel for the day- and that could be well in to the afternoon. Did put a DO not disturb sign- which was obviously noted by staff - have stayed in some hotels where they try to barge in anyway!) Fresh towels everyday and I am a clean freak and noticed surfaces had been wiped down and cleaned. There is a good hair dryer in the room as I am always wary of hairdryers being to weak for my thick hair (in case you lug one in your suitcase as I did)- you really wont need to. Lovely touches in the room with cotton wool, earbuds and even complimentary bottled water- everyday! there was no dressing gown as stated :( but there were slippers. We only managed to get up for breakfast once- which was unfortunate as it was soooo yummy. Choices of a usual turkish breakfast, with added dried fruits, yoghurts, cereals, cheeses, cold meats, bread, butter, boiled eggs, Gozleme (turkish pancake) etc plus hot drinks made freshly- not out of a machine. Staff at the hotel were so helpful with advice on how to get about and even had umbrella's on hand when we needed to go out in the rain. You can order food in to the hotel through their sister restuarant- we didnt do this, just visited the restuarant. No cashpoints at hotel from what I could see- Taksim was literally a 2-3 minute walk away and I would say Taksim is in general a very good place to stay and you can access most places from here. Airport shuttle bus also goes/comes here evey half hour and it was very easy to Sabiha Gokcen Airport with these buses from Taksim. took 55 mins. for 12TL Was very cold at night (mid Feb) so take items to wrap up warm- it could also snow!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Piet v
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel. Very close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The Faros restaurant is also perfect and staff is very friendly and they help you with all your questions about Istanbul. You get maps from Istanbul. When we come to Istanbul again, we definitely go back to Faros Hotel. Rosalie and Piet

Reviews.Title: “Fully satisfied”
Reviews.Author: KlMark
Reviews.Content: My family just come back from the Istanbul and we were fully satisfied with our stay in Faros Hotel. The service and hospitality was great. We stayed 4 nights and were given 1 night free stay plus free transfer from and to the airport (booked directly from their website and you'll get this winter offer). We arrived early morning but there was no room available at that time. But that was not a problem for us as we know that the check in time should be in the afternoon anyway. We were offered free breakfast and this was great after our long journey. While waiting for the room, we took a walk around the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia as the hotel location is just nearby. I took a family room and the room was spacious and convenient for 5 of us (with kids of 12, 10 and 5 years old). My kids enjoyed the room very much. The Manager and staff are very friendly and the service was excellent. Definitely will come back again in this hotel if we have the opportunity to go to Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Our honeymoon in Faros hotel was amazing all in all”
Reviews.Author: Dimachkie
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near :sultanahmet mosque, grand bazaar,haga Sofia,top kapi all within walking distance. Tram station is 2min away. Great generous breakfast, one of the best lunches I ever had in Istanbul the "harem sultan "dish was phenomenal , rooms very clean and classy, extremely friendly staff and great manager. All in all it was a great refferal by our friends. I recommend Faros hotel for your visit to Istanbul every time. Ahmad and salma ( honeymooners)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaNico
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. The breakasts were aweome and the location is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “COMMENTS”
Reviews.Author: JOHN S
Reviews.Content: The excellent manager mr.HALUC KILIC well as the highly trained staff is always on smile at customers disposal. The cleanliness of the rooms exemplary. The complimentary breakfast is very rich and the rich variety of food the restaurand at very good prices. To main thing is that all sights are just around the corner and the tram stops. In general is amazing recommended. GIANNIS POROS ISLAND

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation Sultanahmet Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Debbie M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Faros Hotel in Sultanahmet for 10 days at the end of September 2011 and just loved the accommodation, the staff, the facilities and the proximity. I will definitely stay there again when I am lucky enough to return to that wonderful city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Appealing”
Reviews.Author: Klattu_11
Reviews.Content: This great little hotel is in the perfect location. EVERYTHING is only a short walk. You need to get down to breakfast early because a lot of tourists would come in off the street to eat. Faros is on the main street so can be noisy up until 2am even though we were on the top floor. The only complaint is that the wall paper was peeling off in our room... WTF ....such a small thing that prevents me giving the hotel 5 stars, because we returned to the Faros again at the end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff, comfortable and reasonably priced excellent location Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsa66
Reviews.Content: If Pierre Loti had stayed at the Faros hotel, he would have included it in his magical description of Istanbul. We stayed for a few days in October 2011 and it was the perfect place to stay in a perfect city. The room was spacious, light and comfortable and breakfast was varied and fresh. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The traveller's every need is catered for, even to the point of providing an umbrella in the room. (emergency measure only!). We would recommend this room and are already planning our next trip to Istanbul and the Faros Hotel. To reach the hotel, just take the metro from Ataturk Airport, each traveller would need 2 tickets (jetons), on the sixth station at Zeytinburnu leave the metro and take the tram that is next to the metro station heading to Kabatas, on the 16th stop, sultanahmet, get off the tram and walk back on the opposite direction for 2 minutes and you will find the hotel on the right hand side.

Reviews.Title: “Verry good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gedeon64
Reviews.Content: Faros Hotel in Sultanahmet is really a great place to stay. I stay there 1 week with my mother and a friend and one more time it whas perfect.Verry nice and clean rooms,great breakfast,with alot of choice. Restaurant also verry good they serve verry good foot and the stuff is simply great, always smiling and verry helpfully.Big thanks for the stuff. I recommand this Hotel to everybody you will not be dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: corvette2005
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Faros every trip to Istanbul since it opened. It is in a great location, close to attractions, restaurant and transportation. The staff is always friendly and efficient. The breakfast gets off to a good start for the day. On our last trip we left some valuables in the hotel room. The manager went out of his way to ensure they were promptly sent on to us. There honesty in this matter has made us guests for life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay....”
Reviews.Author: ARUN K
Reviews.Content: We knew we were heading for the right hotel ....thanks to inputs from Busy retired and Kumarjaipur. The place in right in the middle of all the must see places and if there are any far away, then there is the tram station 100 feet from the hotel entrance. The staff are the most courteous and helpful people I have ever met. Special thanks to ERKUT. He is so helpful and courteous and ever smiling !! May his kind come in abundance !! The rooms were well maintained and service good. The breakfast was much better than the other hotel we stayed in Cappadocia. The only grouse being if you are there 4 days in a row, its gets a bit boring because its the same food. All in all we had a great time. Thanks ERKUT once again for making our stay in Istanbul memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anleeb
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is located on a busy street and it can get noisy until late at night. Breakfast was really good and everyone working at Faros are very friendly. Breakfast- Sooooo good

Reviews.Title: “Faros Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bearboat
Reviews.Content: Haluk! We want to say thank you for our fabulous 3 night stay at Faros. Our communications with you prior to our trip were answered immediately and completely. What a lovely hotel, spectacular location and incredible staff. While the hotel is right on teh tram line, we never heard any noise...so convenient. We had a busy 3 days and your wonderful hotel made for extremely comfortable nights. The rooms were extremely comfortable, clean and beautiful. The breakfast, included with the room rate, was delicious and full of many delicious choices. Dinners in your restaurant were extremely tasty and your bar full of many choices.Please know that when we return to Istanbul, and we will, we will be staying at Faros in Sultanahemet. Thank you again. Lisa

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely WONDERFUL hotel”
Reviews.Author: letmego_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Faros Hotel for 5 nights in September 2011. After arriving at 3:00 am Thursday, instead of 1:40 pm Wednesday, due to flight delays, we were very ready for a comfortable bed and much needed sleep. The first night we were put in the "glass room" on the roof....it was wonderful. Unfortunately, due to roof repairs scheduled for the next few days, the staff informed us that we would have to change rooms and they moved our bags down to a standard room on the top floor, overlooking the restaurants in the narrow lane at the side of the hotel. The wonderful food aromas wafting from this lane, were amazing! The room was clean with comfortable beds. The only negative that we found? There is no bathtub and the corner shower is very tiny. I don't know how a larger person would maneuver in this sized shower (NOTE: the shower in the "glass room" on the roof was larger). The hotel staff was amazing. Every request that we presented was met with the response "Immediately", and it was an immediate response. The restaurant staff was friendly, even providing a free turkish liqueur after supper. The breakfast buffet was included in our package and was tasty with good option choices. Excellent yogurt and fresh fruits. It must be noted here that due to religious beliefs, there is no pork in Turkey. The Turkish food is the best that I have ever eaten. We tried different dishes every meal and every one was fantastic...beef, lamb, chicken, etc. I still miss their food! The pastries are unbelievable! If you are a wine drinker, I highly recommend a particularly fine white wine called Kankoy...blissful! The hotel is in a great area for sightseeing and shopping. Prices are reasonable (read..cheap) and don't forget to check out the Turkish Bath down the street as well as the Pudding Cup restaurant close by. If you aspire to more traditional North American fare, MacDonald's is right across the street (but, why would you want to???) Istanbul is amazing and we have already decided to return again next year. We will be staying again at the Hotel Faros...it has it all. Cleanliness, location, excellent food and a staff that is there to please YOU. What more could we ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Jill and Elliot - Such a convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: elliotb_11
Reviews.Content: Despite a flight delay and not landing until after midnight, we were greeted by the hotel representative and ushered onto the hotel shuttle - the best 20 euro worth of transport at that time of night !! The welcome continued from then onwards with all the staff being very helpful and pleasant. The food was particularly good and of high quality - we did not need to search Istanbul for our evening meals. The room was comfortable, if a little smaller than we anticipated from the photographs we had seen. but, we came to the conclusion that had we wanted a larger room we would have been some distance from the main tourist sites . The Faros Hotel is within 5 to 10 minutes walk of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topakapi Palace and the grand Bazaar. The trams run past the hotel and take you to the harbour and the ferry terminals for the Bosphorus (20 minutes walk downhill).It is a boutique hotel with high standards. We have no hesitation in recommending it . Should we return to Istanbul we would happily return to the Faros Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: Shona M
Reviews.Content: We think that this hotel rated the best for friendliness and personal service. The staff were easy to relate to, and service was excellent. Nothing was a problem to them. Hope they are rewarded for this as you are only as good as your staff.

Reviews.Title: “It Is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Husam_82
Reviews.Content: I have been there for 3 past years 2009, 2010 and 2011 and if i am planing to visit Istanbul i will choose Faros Istanbul hotel again for many reasons: service is perfect, free pick up from and to Ataturk airport is perfect service they are accurate and honest. If you are looking to the best location so you are in the best. walk distance from the historical area, around 100 meters away from the tram station. Staffs are friendly and they can help you as much as they can. It is highly recommended, Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and very friendly staff, heart of old city”
Reviews.Author: PC4YOU
Reviews.Content: We have been there for four past years and if we have a plan for futures to travel to Istanbul again we will stay in Faros hotel without any search. it was amazing hotel with the best services from hotel manager Haluk and other staffs, always clean and reedy to help to all gusts. Don't forget to try Faros Resturant also with awesome food and fair price. Hotel is in the best location to have a trip around old city and access to tram. Lovely breakfast with variance of choice, very friendly staffs, free transport from and to airport. I am sure you will never disappointed when you choose Faros Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FrankdeVries_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Faros Hotel end of august 2011 for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. A friendly staff and a very good restaurant. The hotel is located along the main street, tram station is 150 meters away. Only at night it can be a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned - a modern boutique experience”
Reviews.Author: TNfromL
Reviews.Content: Faros is located in the heart of the bustling tourist district, minutes away from all the main sights - and just a stone's throw form the very frequent tram service. The room was lovely, very modern and clean with excellent shower room. (I had my own room - but was told by friends who shared theirs that there was little privacy afforded by the smoked glass door to the WC). Very comfortable bed too.The complimentary Wi-fi worked efficiently and was fast. The breakfast was a nicely presented buffet with enough to fill up on before heading out into wonderful Istanbul. The small terrace outside was superb - and a great place to lunch, dine - and have a glass of wine - and watch the world pass by. The staff were absolutely excellent - really helpful and accommodating. I would wholly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of Istanbul - but also wanting to enjoy a high level of sophisticated service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: mictsia
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days It is a great hotel The room was spacious and above all clean The hotel's location is very near to very important places of visit ,and offers easy access via tram The staff was very friendly and helpful DON'T miss its restaurant.Great food and service at reasonable prices They even offered us complimentary transfer from/to the airport A DEFINITE WINNER

Reviews.Title: “Not for us!!”
Reviews.Author: sweet4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our journey to Istanbul Hotel Faros. There was one person at the reception, he kept answering the phone, and we where getting really agitated, he just ignored us and was more interested in picking up the phone. The Hotel was just ok and nothing else. I also read here that the staff were so friendly, not to us they were not. The restaurant,the food was so awful.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Azamakl
Reviews.Content: We arrived into Istanbul very early in the morning and were provided a transfer to the hotel organised by the hotel. Arriving to the hotel during breakfast, we were asked to join in the breakfast at no charge and the reception by the hotel staff was very warm. Within 15 minutes, our room was organised (well before check-in time) and we settle in quickly. We also had free transfers to the airport for domestic travel. The hotel provides free WiFi internet and this is a bonus. Hotel is in Sultanahmet and within walking distances to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace and Grand Bazaar. Excellent location with restaurants lining the streets, staying at the hotel is like being in a carnival atmosphere as soon as you step out of the hotel, but very quiet when you are within the hotel. I would love to go back, even my kid enjoyed it. Well done Faros.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location,best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: zureen
Reviews.Content: We recenlty stayed at Faros Hotel for a week. The location of the hotel is very convienent the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia,Bascilla Cistern and Topkapi Place is only minutes away. We loved our stay at Faros the rooms are clean and spacious, breakfast good, they provide free hotel tranfers. The staff are very friendly and I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family coming to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in the heart of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: tachfine
Reviews.Content: The Location is brilliant, soon as you come out of the hotel you are soaked by the atmosphere of the old city, staff are friendly, rooms are comfortable, clean and chic, the restaurant serves excellent food at reasonable prices with friendly waiters, ideal location to explore the old city, honestly you can't ask for more. If you stay for more than two doors you get a complientary transfer back to the Airport .

Reviews.Title: “right on the pulse of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: starsanai
Reviews.Content: the title says it all I guess. Its right in the midst of the hustle busle of Sultanahmet-the old city area of Istanbul. If you want peace & quiet look elsewhere. But if you are here to 'feel' istanbul and a doorstep away from all the must-see sights, you'll be glad you booked here. The hotel itself including rooms/toilets/decor/service, etc, is all first rate. Buffet breakfast is good too and so is the restaurant. Other quaint places to eat are also on the doorstep or just round the corner. Overall a very pleasant stay and very good value for money. We stayed for 3 nights- a large family group of 23 including 2 infants and children of all ages. The area was safe & the kids could wander around on their own too. Only sour note was that though we had cancelled 2 rooms well in advance (72 hours cancellation policy), the manager was insistent on charging us for 1 night, even though he had received our email stating that we needed to cancel 2 out of a total of 10 rooms. And we were even booking an additional 1 night. Otherwise a very enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, lovely people, very hospitable!”
Reviews.Author: Sanjiv1958
Reviews.Content: The Faros Hotel is located in the center of all the action, right across all the major sites in Sultanahmet with the Blue Mosque and the Haji Sofia right across with the Grand Bazaar, within a few minutes walk. The Hotel is on the Tram Line with great access to both Eminemi and Taksim Square. The Hotel staff is very hospitable, breakfast is included and of great variety and quality. I enjoyed our stay. The rooms are slightly small but the beds comfortable - one is hardly in the rooms during the day anyway! We will definitely stay there if ever we go to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandSuz
Reviews.Content: A delightful little hotel, would happily stay here again. Very handy to all the attractions, public transport at the door, good food in the restaurant and the service is exceptional. We arrived early and because our standard rooms weren't ready we were upgraded to suites and able to check in immediately, couldn't ask for better service than that.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: EOlney
Reviews.Content: We are already planning our trip to Istanbul and to the Faros for next year. This ai perfect little urban hotel in the center of Sutanhamet. Comfortable, friendly and excellent food and service. The closest hotel to all of the major historical places and sites. If you book the family room, make sure that you request the extra bed, but even if you forget, the hotel staff will rush you a bed immediately. High marks for the Faros!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: stooksk
Reviews.Content: Faros was the perfect base for Istanbul. Right on the tram line, but we never took it - insted opting to walk everywhere. Close to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and virtually everywhere else. Breakfast was very tasty, but not varied. After 4 mornings, my husband wasn't looking forward to it anymore. Airport pick-up and drop-off was a breeze. The room was clean and comfortable. The front desk wasn't able to give tips on how to catch the main boat up the Bosphorus (it's the last ferry on the right before the Galata Bridge) and instead told us just to look out for people shouting out about cruises (no thanks!). We booked online and confirmed 10% cash discount over email. Would have liked the rate to be a bit cheaper, but it seemed in-line with other similar hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “first time we went there we loved it. second time was brilliant”
Reviews.Author: huma_iftikhar
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Faros Hotel in Istanbul, my wife and 3 year old daughter loved it. This hotel is in an amazing place, right in the centre of everything. The free shuttle that they provide is an added bonus. The check-in was very quick we were in room 301 which is a corner suite, has a great view and was very clean, spacious for our daughter to play. The staff is very friendly and very helpful, my daughter has a nut allergy and the manager went out of his way to find her cereals she could eat. Would recommend to anyone with young family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Reddragon26
Reviews.Content: Just a little walk away from the places you like to see in istanbul.. Perfect location very friendly staff.. Thanks faros

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful and accommodating staff, with restaurant service to match.”
Reviews.Author: Applejack047
Reviews.Content: Six people for six days and not a single word against the hotel. We were treated like royalty by the staff, especially Servet and Karakush (?) in the restaurant. We left the ordering of our meals to these two boys and they came through with flying colours every time culminating in our final meal there which brought cheers from the other guests! A spectacular feast! Would recommend this hotel and restaurant to any visitor to Istanbul. It is right in the centre of everything with only a two minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofiya.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: naddy74
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel. Located very conveniently, right in the heart of Sultanahmet, opposite the Tram Stop, nice in-house restaurant, more dining options around, walkable distance from all major sights. Pickup at Airport was smooth and event free. Got exactly the rooms we had asked for - with lovely views of Sultanahmet Square. Rooms were nice and spacious. However the red room (also visible on the website) is a little inconvenient at times because the bathroom is inside the room. But this is not a showstopper because this is the corner room and the views are lovely (windows on 2 sides) and one can spend hours with a coffee cup, gazing outside. Staff was very friendly (especially the front desk). The manager went out of his way to help us fax / email some important documents. Food in the in-house restaurant was very nice. We loved it more than Hamdi (at Eminonu; which is somehow rated higher by a lot of people). Will love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great food in a fantastic restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Ruby06London
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful restaurant in a great location. The staff are very friendly and the restaurant offers a large selection of some of the best food I have eaten in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Family Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: sahmedpitt
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Traveling with 2 young children, we enjoyed the full buffet breakfast as well as the convenience of being walking distance from many sites of interest. We easily walked (with stroller) to Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Basilla Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and more. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique hotel in the centre of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Skiboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days last week. We arrived at 9pm, and as this was our first visit, were very grateful for the complimentary transfer to and from the airport. Our driver was very friendly and gave us a running commentary of all the landmarks as we made the short journey to the hotel. On arrival, check in was very efficient and we were upgraded to a suite for the duration of our stay. During our stay, all the staff were very friendly ome and were always keen to come and have a chat any time they could. The hotel itself is on the main tramway and just around the corner from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Topkapi Palace. The Grand Bazaar is only about a 10 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an inspiring city !!”
Reviews.Author: TaTo0o0o0
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 25th of February 2011 at the Sahiba airport in the Asian side of the city from Rome. The driver of the hotel was waiting for us and he took us to the Faros hotel for 40 euro (considering that it takes 1 hour and an half, with a lot of traffic on the bridges). The hotel's receptionist called GÃ¼ven (in Italian Giovanni) was very kind and he make us feel very welcome and he gave us some important tips about Istanbul. The room (we were 4 persons) was very big, clean and comfortable. We spent 2 nights in the Faros restaurant and it was very very very nice, with fantastic food,fantastic service and fantastic atmosfere .. The breakfast was the best we had in a hotel .. ever!! It was very big and delicious, with turkish and english breakfast. We recommend this hotel to everyone!! Can't wait to come back and eat a kebap while the muezzin sings from the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Perfect Place to Stay... Right next to all the Attractions in a walking distance...”
Reviews.Author: SAKader
Reviews.Content: Love the Place. All the Attractions are in walking distance. The Hotel Staff are very helpful. I would strongly recomend for all my friends and collegues...

Reviews.Title: “I would like to come back again...at any time”
Reviews.Author: tanika777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Faros Hotel at the end of January, 2011 for 4 nights. There was our 2-nd time in this hotel (the first was last year). Faros offer a free transfer from and to Ataturk airport. Last time our flight to Istanbul was delayed for 4 hours, so we were sure nobody met us because we arrived late at night, but a driver was still waiting for us in the airport! Faros hotel is a very cosy place, that is why we choosed it for our second trip to Istanbul. We had such pleasant feelings like we came back home. Mr. Haluk Kilic (Hotel Manager) was very kind and offered to us (as repeat guests) a big family room instead of standard double. It was a nice surprise but if to say the true - double room during our first visit was also very comfortable and big enough. We appreciated all in this hotel: location on Divan Yolu, warm rooms (this is actually during winter season), tasty breakfast, good restaurant with variety menu (and 10% discount for hotel guests), service, cleanliness. Wi-fi was free and had normal speed. May be only one moment was unexpected - music during breakfasts was boring and the same every day, so on the third morning we had to ask to change it and it was changed at once. People at the reception (like all staff) were very polite and always ready to help with any request. Thanks all of them. I am sure â€“ when I visit Istanbul again â€“ I will stay at Faros Sultanahmet only! P.S. I put some new fotos of Faros, so you can take a look :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the middle of Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: scorpioshanghai
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant stay. The internet rate was good and included return transfers to/fro airport which was very handy. Being picked up from airport is really useful especially if this is 1st visit to Istanbul as the taxi queues etc are confusing and language is a problem as not everyone speaks English. The hotel is on Divan Yolu right on the tram line opposite the Blue Mosque and Aga Sofya so its well positioned for taking in all the sights. Request a room at the back if you are a light sleeper as front rooms can hear the rambling of the trams as they pass right in front. We got upgraded to a bigger room as we stayed for 6 nights and the staff were helpful and very pleasant. Room was sufficient and although not 5star luxury and designer chic.....it had everything you could ask for. Large free bottle of mineral water daily, kettle and coffe/tea in room plus all the toiletries although toothbrush not provided but then no hotels in Europe provide this. Breakfast was fine and one can ask for apple tea or peppermint tea besides the usual chai they serve. You can also request for them to cook your eggs fresh even though they have scrambled eggs on the hot plate. Fresh fruits yoghutr cereal all there so it was a decent spread. You also get a 10|% discount when dining at their restaurant which is was fairly decent food. There was always a nice crowd dining there and prices are reasonable. The only downside I canthink of is that the beds are a little soft and lumpy but not so ucomfortable that it ruined my sleep.........I still slept very well each night. Enjoyed our stay but in retrospect i think i would select a hotel in Taksim area as there is much more to do there in evenings. Better variety of restaurants and nightlife. Staying there would mean an easier trek home at night. The sights in Sultanhamet are easy enough to get to during daytime. But for a 1st timer to istanbul, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great choice - in line with our expectations”
Reviews.Author: tinamaria
Reviews.Content: The Faros Hotel in the Sultanahmet area was a great choice. We booked a family room and we were assigned a corner room - it was spacious, clean, confortable with a "twist"- nice drapery colors, confortable king size bed, wooden floor, mini fridge with plenty of drinks, complimentary bottled water. Corner rooms are good for families of three. Our friends got a standard family room , great size, big enough for four and plenty of space for suitcases still allowing some living space. The hotel has a tiny but stylish hall. The personnel is very nice, professional, polite, speakes english and is willing to go that extra step to makeyou feel at ease. I definitely suggest Faros hotel and I would choose it for a second trip to wonderful Istanbul. Last but not least a special comment to Giovanni - the concierge, this is his name translated in italian, unfortunatelly I don't remember it in Turkish and I apologise because Giovanni was really great.He was very professional, and did his best to provide us with all of our requests. We travel with young children - 4 of them ranging from 8 to 13 years old. We had no problems at all during our stay in Istanbul. It was a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: baccardi1_10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel verry clean and conforteable rooms,verry friendly Stuff and always there to help ypu if you need.Verry good breakfast and also the restaurant is verry good i just can recommand you this place.

Reviews.Title: “The management and staff were superb, customer care was their priority”
Reviews.Author: zimmer1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 5 month old daughter at the Hotel Faros, Sultanahmet, for 14 nights to develop new business contacts in Istanbul. The hotel arranged for us to be picked up at the airport terminal by minibus on our arrival. We were welcomed by the staff and given info about the various tourist attractions/trips. The room was very clean. The hotel is located on a main tramway which for us was extremely convenient for getting to business meetings cheaply. The restaurant staff were fantastic, entertaining our daughter whilst we ate meals in peace! The hotel management was superb, assisting us with website translations etc. The food was lovely and we used room service in the evening when working. We were 10 mins walk from the Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service - my best hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: twogaffneys
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller and was overwhelmed by the service at the Faros Hotel. I have and will continue to recommend this hotel highly to anyone. The Faros Hotel is definitely a reason to come back to Istanbul. We loved it! I stayed at the hotel for eleven nights and after excessive noise from a party across the street on my first night, Mr Kilic (the hotel manager) arranged for me to be moved to a more spacious and quieter room for the rest of my stay before breakfast the next morning! I was amazed at how expedient his response was and how warmly they treated myself and my eight year old daughter.

Reviews.Title: “it is a dream hotel-best value for money”
Reviews.Author: IrfanKhan113
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this fabulous hotel in November 2010 and I am delighted to express my views to help other tourists to be able to select a worthy hotel such as Faros Hotel. Location - excellent because all the worth-seeing attractions and shopping areas are at a walking distance, rooms - quite large and comfortable, service - in all departments was par excellence, starting from the Manager, Mr. Haluk and extending to the entire staff. You get all this for a price which is extremely reasonable and includes breakfast, free wireless internet and two-way airport transfers. If I ever come to Istanbul, this is our hotel to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Sultanahmet Area!”
Reviews.Author: MKHAN22
Reviews.Content: Faros Hotel is a charming hotel which is ideally located in Sultanahmet, within minutes walking distance of all important tourist attractions such as Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Grand Bazaar and Topkapi Palace. The tariff per night is brilliant and very competitive in comparison to other hotels and includes breakfast, airport transfers and free wireless internet... amazing deal!! The rooms are extremely comfortable and elegantly decorated with all amenities possible. What is most striking about this hotel is the incredibly supportive and friendly management and staff - - Guvan, is extremely helpful and brilliant at suggesting sightseeing tours while the the Manager Haluk and Erkut are always happy to address any issues and immediately assist in every way! Faros Hotel also has an excellent restaurant which is one of the best in the area and offers 10% discount to its guests. This hotel is one of the most friendly and comfortable hotels I have stayed in and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Istanbul -- staying here has made our trip all the more special and memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: Gfreire
Reviews.Content: I was there with my mom and my aint. WE loved the hotel... the location is great, staff is the best ones i have ever seen. the room was big, clean and very confortable. Breakfast was very good. very close to the historical city. Many hotels around but would for sure not choose a better one. want to be back and for sure back to the same hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for good price”
Reviews.Author: nina060
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - near historic center of town, Large and clean room and bathroom Very helpful staff Good breakfest

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris241248
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a superb position for the best sights in Istanbul (walking distance of Agia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cistern, the Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace) and is surrounded by good restaurants. The staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful and the promised airport transfers worked smoothly. The only negative is the tram line in front of the hotel which makes the rooms at the front a bit noisy if you want to have the window open. However, its location more than cancels this out. All in all a very good hotel; highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great staff,great location”
Reviews.Author: vickuna
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Faros for 5 nights.The hotel could not be more central - near all major attractions and the tram line. The staff is extremely friendly,helpful and nice! The restaurant had a great food. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nestinarka
Reviews.Content: Our 4-days stay was great, very welcoming staff, esp. the Hotel Manager, who personally showed us a different type of room and offered upgrade, as ours wasnt ready yet. Very good location, just in the heart of Sultanahmet area. Will definitely go back to the hotel, once we decide to visit Istanbul again!

Reviews.Title: “Such friendly and helpful service”
Reviews.Author: SallyDelos
Reviews.Content: This location of this hotel is convenient for everything - walking distance from all the major attractions and on the tram route. We were accommodated in the 'terrace room' which was roomy and private. The staff were so helpful and nothing was too much trouble for the guys on reception who bent over backwards to assist. A take away breakfast was organised for us when we had to leave early on a tour; we were offered complimentary drinks when a tour pick up was delayed and it is these types of gestures that are really appreciated by guests. An excellent hotel and one that I would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and location for visiting Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dsrose10
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and quite helpful. Plenty of options for breakfast including fresh fruits, cheeses and wonderful breads. The king size bed was very comfortable, though it took up most of the room. Amenities included a safe, flat screen tv, toiletries and a large bottle of water daily. Location was perfect. We enjoyed several dinners on the patio; order the meze along with an Efes dark beer for a nice dinner. We booked the hotel for our first three nights in Istanbul, and then two additonal nights for when we returned from visiting other areas in the country. Upon our return we were advised that the hotel had overbooked and there was no room for us. The manager was quite apologetic as he explained we would be staying at a comparable hotel nearby. He also offered us a complimentary dinner. Staff took our luggage to the Hotel Sultanhan, located on a quiet side street. Staff was cordial and the hotel was lovely. Breakfast was on the roof terrace which commanded wonderful views of the Marmara Sea as well as the nearby Blue Mosque, however, the food was not as interesting and the staff was somewhat formal and not friendly. The following day our luggage was returned to Hotel Faros and we were given another room, somewhat larger than the first, with a comfortable king size bed. That evening we enjoyed a three course meal with alcohol "on the house." Additionally, twice we had to leave in the morning before breakfast. The night staff was very accomodating, and helped us get tea and some rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel for women alone or with children”
Reviews.Author: Merechat2
Reviews.Content: My youngest son and I visited Istanbul in Ocotober of 2009 for our birthdays. We had both wanted to travel to Turkey for awhile, but as my husband is in the military and recently returned from Iraq he was a little hesitant. After finding this hotel and several tours, he allowed us to go. I booked the hotel through Expedia and paid for everything up front. The Sunday before the trip I called the hotel to confirm and set up an airprot pick-up. Plans and room were confirmed along with a point of contact. When we arrived at the airport, there was no one from the hotel to pick us up. I called the hotel and they told me I woud have to take a taxi because it was so late, 2300. We arrived at the hotel and were told that our room had been given to someone else and that we could only stay one night because the hotel was full. I showed the desk clerk my reservation, confirmation and receipt and was promptly informed that they didn't honor bookings from Expedia. Because it was so late, we paid the fee again for the hotel. The next morning we met with the manager and he told us there wasn't a room in the hotel for the rest of our stay and all the hotels in the city were booked because of the IMF conference. The manager's aid took us to a travel agent to try find a room. We wound up taking a trip to Kusadasi and Ephesus since there were no available rooms! While in Kusadasi my husband and I tried to find out about having the room we had already paid for ready when we returned to Istanbul. We both received confirmation and a confirmation number saying we would have a room when we returned. We arrived back at the hotel after 2300 to be told that there was no room and that we would have to find lodging else where. I reminded him that we had already paid and was told it didn't matter. We were then told to leave the hotel. This was after midnight. The manager didn't care that we had no place to go and that I was a lone woman in a large city with an 11 yo boy in the middle of the night. I have to admit that I was terrified. After gathering my witts, we found a travel agent that was still open and he found us a room at the Sheraton. This was an amazing hotel and I would stay there again. After returning home, I found out that the hotel sent a bill to Expedia for the stay that I never was able to use. Because of the unscrupulous manager, we had to pay an additional $1750 for our trip and I have not received a refund from either the hotel or Expedia. I don't know where the disconnect came from with our stay and it may just have been someone wanting to get more money for the room, but this was not a good thing to go through. We made the best of the situation (trip to Kusadasi and Ephesus), but the issue with the hotel really put a damper on our fun and my husband won't let us travel back there again. The hotel had a perfect location and the room seemed nice but if you are a woman alone or traveling with children, I would think twice about booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff and management team, very clean”
Reviews.Author: PC4YOU
Reviews.Content: That is the third time we stay in faros hotel and we are very pleased to chose faros hotel again. We get the same room with same price as before. We stay there for two weeks and I can't tell you how fantastic this hotel. It is very closed to Blue Mosque and transport. We would like to say a big thanks to Haluk who is the manager and his team which they make great services and very helpful. When you walk in throw the door you can feel it how professional they are, from reception for instance Guven who help not only to us but also to every one. There is a lovely breakfast and all staff very friendly and polite. I would recommended to every one if they are looking for a nice hotel and close to old historical Istanbul. We would like to thank all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with the ideal location”
Reviews.Author: tigertul
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky to find this hotel which is located about 5 minutes away from the major tourist attractions in Istanbul being the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The Hotel is located on the tram station which makes it very easy to go anywhere in the city without walking to much. It has a very good restaurant so if you are tired after a long day of walking you can still get good food. The hotel offers discount on city tours which are very informative. The rooms are very nicely done. The best part of the hotel was the guy who was at the front desk, Mr. Guven Cakmakci. Every Hotel needs someone like him, he was very helpful in guiding us to eating joints, historical places etc. Faros Hotel is a very good value for money and you cant go wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: MarialeAli
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul this summer with two other friends and staying at Faros made the trip simply amazing. The service was great, the staff was always very helpful and interested in showing you the best of Istanbul. The rooms were extremely comfortable, and the location perfect. I totally recommend this hotel to anyone because staying there will make your trip unforgettable and you'll definitely want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay-good value for price-friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaPalha
Reviews.Content: we stayed one week in this very friendly hotel the staff is particularly helpful, with advices on trips and visits, choosing dishes at the restaurant, etc. since travelled with kids (11 and 18), the friendly nature of the staff was highly appreciated. the location is perfect, 5 min away from blue mosque, the bazaar or ayasophia and there is a subway station 200m away. very good food at the hotel restaurant and moderately priced. rooms were clean and comfortable. overall, a good stay and a welcome feeling from all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: Mohitoswal
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel through tripadvisor review and we were not disappointed. Surprisingly spacious family room to sleep 4 and a large Bath. Tea coffee maker and a refrigerator along with a locker were a welcome addition. The service was impeccable, Bugro the manager at the reception is a dream come true for a tourist, he is genuinely concerned and goes the extra mile to make you comfortable. One can not ask for a better location, The blue mosque , Aya sofia , the cistern and the grand mosque are within 300 meter radius with the tram stopping some 50 meters away from the Hotel . Mc Donaldâ€™s on the opposite street and Star Buck shares a common wall. Great cafes near by including the COZY RESTAURANT (awesome) and the MAdo cafe some 50 meters down towards the blue mosque. Avoid the eating joint selling WAFFLES opposite right of this hotel for outride rude service and bad food. The hotel really made us comfortable and added to the lovely time we had in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Fantastisk”
Reviews.Author: penco_88_19
Reviews.Content: The service was really good, and the personal was very helpful. Every thing was just perfekt.

Reviews.Title: “Spot-on location in Sultanahment, great access to main attractions in Old City and superb hotel team.”
Reviews.Author: JulietteM
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Faros for 4 nights. We had a wonderful time in Istanbul & this hotel. We felt welcome from the time we arrived (at 3am!) until our departure. The room was very nicely decorated and the air conditioner worked perfectly (meaning it worked as expected *and* guests could set its temperature to whatever setting is desired). The room was also quiet when the window/door to the street was closed, but we enjoyed listening to the sounds of the street, including the call to prayer (adhÄ�n). The personnel was outstanding, always aiming to please guests. They helped us decide from which restaurants to try to which way to walk to the city attractions. Our reservation also included a breakfast buffet with traditional & Turkish breakfast items. We will definitely be back in Istanbul and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The strengths, location old city location, great food, hospitable staff, outway the negatives.”
Reviews.Author: ADR1955
Reviews.Content: The negatives being, sometimes minute shower cubicles, no daily drinking water in the room as promised, and disastrous airport transfer system. It is well priced for a tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: zuk71
Reviews.Content: We've spent 4 nights in this hotel during our wedding anniversary and were absolutely satisfied! We got complement (cake and cocktails) from hotel staff for our great date. My wife was happy! Number one advantage is a hotel's location and great reception staff. Frankly speaking I've never seen so deeply interested staff to make our stay easy and enjoying. I want to say many thanks to Bugra Sume, front office manager for his great help. Hotel manager was very kind as well. Bugra is a mainly day-time front office manager and you can ask him for any help or assistance and you'll get it! Once we had dinner in hotel's restaurant and food was great. I would recommend this hotel to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: CliffnTiziano
Reviews.Content: We were collected from Istanbul airport. Staff are very friendly and helpful, which is so nice when you arrive into a city such as this for the first time. The hotel could not be more central - near all major attractions and the tram line. Great restaurant at the hotel. We were originally meant to stay 5 nights, but ended up spending a few extra nights due to the volcano in April. The staff could not have been more accommodating and helpful and went out of their way to assist us. Would highly recommend this hotel. Thank you to everyone in the Faros hotel for making our trip so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddental
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 2 times ,, and will return to it each time I will be in Istanbul ,, you will feel at home immediately when you reach the hotel and speak with the nice staff there ,, rooms are clean ,, although it is located near to a busy boulevard ,, all rooms are double glazed so no noise at all ,, its location in the old cilty and the access to it are just excellent ,, the hotel is very near to Blue mosque ,, Aya Sofia and ald bazarr ,, prices are very reasobable and the breakfast is very good and quiet enough and logical .. I recommend this hotel to anyone wants to sleep well , eat well ,, and see Istanbul the rest of the day ,, by the way they have rooms for family Father , mother and 2 big children ,, very practical ,,

Reviews.Title: “a quick restfull weekend”
Reviews.Author: brothergg
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife we had a great weekend while we were in istanbul for a quick bussiness-holiday kind of visit. sultanamet is a great place to stay if you like to visit some historical places especially when you dont have much time but the best is finding a nice place to spend th night and have a peacefull sleep. Faros Hotel is the perfect match. Its really nice and clean and the staff are really kind and helpfull. Thanks guys. Hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “superb!”
Reviews.Author: sara_arif
Reviews.Content: Faros hotel/restaurant stands out amongst all its competitors in Istanbul. It was refreshing to see such lively staff, modern interiors, wonderful service and not forgetting the variety of food that was offered in the restaurant. The location is fantastic! all the main tourist sites are within walking distance, not forgetting that the tram stop is right outside the hotel. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay, and I will definitely make a return to this fantastic hotel. Thanks faros for making my first trip to Istanbul thoroughly enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: kumarjaipur
Reviews.Content: We are just back from Istanbul .Stayed for seven nights at Hotel Faros.on Divan Yolu. The location is absolutely fantastic for sight seeing as we could walk to all the major attractions on level ground. No steep climbing required. Trams stop is about two minutes away.Had taken a triple room. It was spacious and spotlessly clean. Huge window overlooking the street. But glazing was good so that street noise did not disturb us..In room safe was not working but the manager got it repaired the next day. . Break fast was good ,but the same menu every day. The draw back- no sea view slightly tired looking towels. could do with fluffy towels. Otherwise An excellent hotel. , helpful manager and free drop to Ataturk Airport. Rates rather on the high side 140 euros per night. when we stayed

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people”
Reviews.Author: jocdocnh
Reviews.Content: Very nice clean rooms. Beds are a little firm. Had a wonderful view of the Bosphorus from our balcony on top floor. Very good breakfast daily. Hotel's restaurant gives you 10% discount on meals and is as good as anything close by. Easy walk to the Blue Mosque. Streetcar line stop is one block down the road. Concierge was VERY nice and helpful with recommendations for eating and tours although our tours were all set. Aziz in the restaurant went out with our two teens in the evening for a great time! ONLY negative is if you are large person the shower is very tight.

Reviews.Title: “over all an excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: peach02
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Our over all experience was excellent on every aspect, it is a credit to the manager. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and if we ever return to istanbul we will definitely stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lin_2306
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel for several times now. It's a perfectly good hotel, with great services and the rooms are clean and modern. You can have lovely meals there aswell and the hotel is in the middle of the turistic area of Istanbul. I have been to several hotels in Istanbul but none of them were as lovely and great as FAROS hotel! So dont hesitate, just book this one and you wont regret it!!! x Linda

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a big city”
Reviews.Author: cristian66180
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice place to stay and spend some time in the wonderful Instanbul. Nice people for the staff, very helpful, with a very good common sense. Asked for a quite room and I had the feeling to be too quite, except the five minutes in the morning when the cleaning lady came to work :). Comparing to some other hotels in the area you can see very easy the difference of the management quality, especially for the terrace and the hotel restaurant. Tea coffe and juice on the spot the day we come, were very wellcome. We had a double standard room which was clean and cozy.This is a real boutique hotel in Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, comfortable rooms, accomodating and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: johnkeble1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in the Faros Hotel several tlmes in the last three years. Each time the rooms have been comfortable with all the appointments we wanted or needed. The staff has always been polite, informative and prompt to accommodate any questions or help we might need. The hotel is in the medium price range, but the value has been exceptionally good. The management itself is directly involved in the operations of the hotel and quite sensitive to the comfort and needs of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for a hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: yatravellingMac
Reviews.Content: Both the hotel and the restaurant was very good. The hotel is very centrally located in Istanbul and within walking distance to a lot of the main tourist attractions. Tried a few restaurants in the city before having our last couple of meals here as nothing we could find came close. The rooms are good, a little worn down, but otherwise clean and in good shape. Despite being very centrally located it was very quiet and there were no problems sleeping all through the night. Have no problems recommending this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “An average 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: lostinbelgrade
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived from a three days visit to wonderul Istanbul. After reading several reviews at Trip Advisor, I decided to book a double room at Hotel Faros. The surprise was that when I arrived to the hotel, the hotel manager welcomed us apologising that there was a problem and our reservation had not been made, even if I had received an e-mail confirmation. I was really upset. However, I have to recognise that the hotel manager did his best to solve the trouble in a professional way. First, he organised for us to stay in another hotel, two minutes walk from Faros (and I would say, a much better hotel). Second, we got a one night free of charge. So, they made a mistake but at least they reacted very professionally. Must admit it. Now, speaking about the hotel itself, in my opinion it is an average 3 stars urban type small hotel. To highlight something, the location is excellent (2 minutes walk to the Blue mosque) and that the staff was in general kind and helpful. The hotel is clean and the rooms are quite new. That is the positive part. The negative part is that you pay 160 Euro for a 3 stars hotel, that you find yourself having breakfast at the hotel lobby (no separate restaurant is available), and that the hotel facilities are really those of a 3 stars hotel from any capital in Europe. All in all, sweet and sour taste in our mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful TurkÄ±sh hospÄ±talÄ±ty and servÄ±ce Ä±n tÄ±ptop locatÄ±on”
Reviews.Author: more63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Faros for 3 nÄ±ghts and were not dÄ±sappoÄ±nted wÄ±th anythÄ±ng but the rooms whÄ±ch were a bÄ±t tÄ±red and our corner suÄ±te was quÄ±rky. But the servÄ±ce and welcome was terrÄ±fÄ±c for four tÄ±red long haul travellers. We arrÄ±ved very early and one of our rooms was made ready asap so we could clean up whÄ±le breakfast was generously offered to keep the kÄ±ds happy. In fact we had some early starts for tours and so on but each tÄ±me the helpful hotel staff offered us a good breakfast to send us on our way well before the regular openÄ±ng hours. ThÄ±s lÄ±ttle hotel has vÄ±ews of the Blue Mosque from the sunny corner suÄ±tes whÄ±ch would be much Ä±mproved wÄ±th new wall paper etc and perhaps better qualÄ±ty bathrooms though Ä±mportantly the water pressure was fÄ±ne, whÄ±ch Ä±s not always the case Ä±n Turkey. KÄ±ds had a regular shaped suÄ±te whÄ±ch was dark but better desÄ±gned. Beds were very comfortable and the posÄ±tÄ±on by the tram stop was handy and not as noÄ±sy as you would expect. There Ä±s a buzzy Ä±ndoor and pavement cafe whÄ±ch does good standard dÄ±nners and the breakfast buffet offers hot and cold choÄ±ces. Hotel management went out of theÄ±r way to get us to places we wanted and even provÄ±ded a free aÄ±rport bus transfer when we had to tear ourselves away from Istanbul for some other places on our Ä±tÄ±nerary!

Reviews.Title: “great location ,great service, easy access to where ever you want to go in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: turanity
Reviews.Content: We ve stayed at Faros Hotel in february and that wasnt the first and the last time .location does matter to me where ever i travel .not being a local of the area you need easy access to means of transportation in this case Faros Hotel is just next to the Tram station which i believe connects central Istanbul in a great way . Needless to say the Hotel itself stands out from the other ones when you look at it anyway cos as we all know when you want to book something online the pictures help alot and they could be a little misleading sometimes whereas for Faros what you see is what you get .. There s a lovely pub underneath the Hotel which is very very comfortable you can basically sit down there and spend the whole day people watching and enjoy your food and drinks ... The staff is very helpful and they all speak fluent English..They give you a feeling that you can ask them anything and they can help you about it.. As i said earlier we really enjoyed our stay there and we definitely think we ll go back and stay at Faros again and again and again...

Reviews.Title: “perfect 'mix' for a perfect trip”
Reviews.Author: LuanMeraku
Reviews.Content: Hotel Faros in Istanbul has the perfect mix for the perfect holiday or business trip: location, staff, service, beauty and elegance. I went for couple of days with my family and ended up extending for the whole week. Faros staff is truly a synonymous of great customer services, it is located in the core city center (proximity to the Blue Mosque, Top Kapi Palace etc) and it also has an amazing indoor and outdoor restaurant. The rooms (especially the suites) were very nicely decorated and very clean and tidy - just amazing. Hotel staff is yet another story. In several occasions (being it business or pleasure) they were able to genuinely assist me. I even started to call in for info. It was just like having a private concierge. Definitely and without a doubt I would recommend Faros Hotel to all type of travelers. I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: BanffAcorn
Reviews.Content: Amazing location directly across from the Blue Mosque, walking distance to the Grand Bazaar and right in front of the city Metro system. Without asking the Hotel arranged complimentary to and from the Airport. rooms were very well appointed and clean. Despite being on the main street noise was not an issue. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel...warm, friendly, great location..can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: mzmanchester
Reviews.Content: A perfectly located hotel which made exploring Istanbul very easy as a first time visitor to the city. The main tourist attractions really are a short walk away , with the Blue mosque quite literally at the end of the street!! Public transport amenities on the doorstep make it easy to travel into the city centre, and taxi fares are also reasonable for this district. Staff are friendly, well presented & always helpful any time night or day. Rooms are clean, spacious & comfortable with a very modern feel. The restaurant downstairs has a great menu with something for everyone and a lovely atmosphere. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and will be booking it again for my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Faros made our trips to Istanbul unforgettable.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times and both have been super. Rooms are great size, very clean and bright! Staff are so friendly and helpful and can't do enough to make your stay super! The hotel is in an ideal location, close to all the main tourist attractions and nightlife and if you don't want to stray too far the bar within the hotel offers great food and drink all day. Look forward to staying here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in the Centre of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Schlitzzz
Reviews.Content: My collegues and I stayed in the Faros hotel for two nights on the way back from business in Eskisehir. Our trip to Istanbul was a long one and once we arrived, the hotel manager Haluk ensured that our cab driver knew the exact location of the hotel. Once at the hotel, our luggage was quickly moved to our rooms and Haluk and his staff were perfect hosts. They made us feel very welcome with a complimentary cup of tea in the relaxing cafe and provided us with information about restaurants, entertainment and sporting events. The rooms were all well appointed and the hotel definately deserves a 4-star rating for it's level of service and the quality of the rooms. The breakfast was quite extensive and provides just the right amount of fuel to get you through a day of touring the city. Our plane left early in the morning (before the typical Breakfast hours) and they ensured that a "lunch box meal" was provided for us so that we wouldn't go to the airport hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: wcecu
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel to stay in Istanbul weather you go for business or leisure, the location is perfect for both. It is just minutes away from main touristic attractions, there is city tram stop just outside the hotel door and the hotel can help with public parking lot information if required. We stay for two nights and the staff made us feel comfortable they were very frindly and helpfull. Rooms are well decorated and have everything that todayÂ´s travellers need.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to stay and explore”
Reviews.Author: bb_ely
Reviews.Content: Just steps away from Sultanahmet tram station. The hotel is just right in front of the Sultanahmet Mosque and Hagya Sophia museum, about 10-15 mins walk from Grand Bazaar and Topkapi Palace. The rooms are large, though its a queen size bed and the shower stall fits 2 just right. Hot water worked fine and WIFI worked well in the room. Room was facing the opposite restaurant so obviously had some street noise, early morning prayer call but not a problem. Breakfast was good with simple selections, cereals and juices. Rate a little pricey at 100Euros a night being the start of the peak season (but it was only end of March and it's still winter!!) but can't fault the location. Would stay here again in the low season when its so much more value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly brilliant Fantastic Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: anwar786
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the best hotel i have ever been two. The staff were brilliant and could communicate well in English>. Haluk the manager made our stay that so much easier he went that extra mile he even helped us plan our holiday to different places in turkey which wasnt part of his job. The staff go that extra mile for you. The hotel is at prime location next to Starbucks and Opposite Macdonalds only 200 meters from blue mosque, Hagia sofia Museam and Topkapi Palace. 5 star Service

Reviews.Title: “One of the best boutique hotels we've been!”
Reviews.Author: SilvioNovelli
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Services are excellent and friendly. I felt like home. I can recommend this hotel to anyone without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice located hotel”
Reviews.Author: pomerani
Reviews.Content: In general satisfactory. close to blue mosque. many restaruant near by. Room is not big but clean. Staffs were kind. Breakfast also good. FYI due to tram, the taxi can't access to front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute choise in istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: portugal14
Reviews.Content: I go often to istanbul and have stayed already in many hotels. FAROS is definatively my choise due to relation Price/quality! Not so expensive for many, and with wonderfull conditions! Localization: where you need to be! Size of the hotel: perfect! Staff: wonderfull! Restaurant: the best in istanbul! If i could.. i'd return today!

Reviews.Title: “Best oriental type hotel in excellent historical location.”
Reviews.Author: MohamedAhmadi
Reviews.Content: Do, Room is perfectly color matched and clean, organized, and comfort. located in middle of all attraction places, Tram station stops itâ€™s like 2 minutes away from hotel. Don't I couldn't figure out why the double bedroom includes one chair. My room was positioned to the right side of the other building, therefore no particular view. I recommend requesting it in advance. Internet connection was boring and slow. interart3d@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, defÄ±netly would reccommend, very near sÄ±te and tram excellent servÄ±ce.”
Reviews.Author: uzakhan
Reviews.Content: faros hotel was excellent value for money. excellent staff especÄ±ally the receptÄ±on and manager. They all spoke englÄ±sh whÄ±ch was so helpful. the hotel was very near all the sÄ±tes. the breakfast was very good, contÄ±nental and turkÄ±sh. Ä± would truly reccommend Ä±t for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, location, and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AGC74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an ideal position to take advantage of all that Istanbul has to offer. The corner suites were well furnished, clean and very comfortable. The staff, particularly the manager, Mr. Kilic, were extremely courteous and accommodating. The breakfast was varied and of good quality. Although no meeting facilities exist on the property, they were able to convert one of the rooms into a very functional meeting space for our group. I would highly recommend this hotel to both business and leisure travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Just The best! Wonderful location, very friendly staff, nice room . I felt at home”
Reviews.Author: Olivia8010
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my mom and sister. We had a very nice time. The mom was nice and , the staff was very very friendly and also the restaurant at the hotel was good. Furthermore, the hotel was a few blocks from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and a walk distance from the Gran Bazar!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & option in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFast
Reviews.Content: Faros Hotel is perfectly located in the Sultanahmet (old town) area, close to the major sites. I had a corner suite for 79 Euros (regular rooms were 60 Euros), which was spacious and clean. (At checkout the bill was in Turkish Lira, not Euros.) They arrange a private driver from the airport for stays of 2 nights or more (most hotels do this and I recommend it). There is some daytime noise since itâ€™s located on the Divan Yolu (tram runs on this street), but Iâ€™m a light sleeper and it didnâ€™t bother me at all. However you will hear the morning call to prayer (5-6am) via loudspeakers, regardless of where you stay in this area since there are over 2,000 mosques in Istanbul. There are some restaurants on the side street adjacent to the hotel which close by midnight, but I was up late so I never heard any noise. Location-wise, youâ€™re perfectly located on the main street between the Grand Bazaar (walking 10 mins), Blue Mosque (5 mins), Aya Sofia (7-10 mins), and 2 minutes from the Sultanahmet tram stop, plus it's located next to the Starbucks and McDonald's for easy landmarks. (The tram is $1 and convenient to almost any site in Istanbul, and connects to the funicular to Istiklal Street across the Bosphorous). The Faros is a nice, upscale hotel in a great location. The front desk staff and restaurant/bar staff were all extremely nice and helpfull. Hotel offers wi-fi for the internet, or you can use their laptop in the lobby to check your email, which was great as I didnâ€™t want to carry my laptop halfway around the world. The included breakfast was good and offered a large buffet featuring a Mediterranean breakfastâ€”cheeses, meats, olives, tomatoes, cucumbers, plus scrambled eggs, cereals, breads, coffee, tea, etc. There are flatscreen tv's (English news) so you can catch up on world news. My only complaint was that after traveling 18 hours through 3 airports, I arrived (they knew I was a woman traveling solo), and my room wasnâ€™t available due to some airport weather cancellations.
