They offered me a room located by itself on the roof, accessible by going out a door on the top floor, and up a spiral staircase to the roof. I did not want to stay isolated in this location by myself in a foreign country, and the manager was annoyed that I wasnâ€™t comfortable with the option, even suggesting that if I didn't like his offer I should find a new hotel for the remainder of my trip! They made arrangements for me to stay at the Amisos hotel for one night (loud due location over an English pub), but didnâ€™t offer to give me a discount or other option to accommodate me. On a 3.5-day trip, it was a major disruption to my schedule, as I couldnâ€™t check in until 1pm the next day and it cut directly into a scheduled tour that Iâ€™d made for that morning. That was my only complaint about the Faros. Once I did get checked into the Faros, my experience was was excellent and I would stay here again. I recommend 3 restaurants near the hotel: 1) Amedros (Divanyolu hoca Rustem Sk. No. 7)â€”located on side street next to Faros. Great staff, delicious lamb, and meze appetizers (rated No. 1 on Trip Advisor). 2) Mozaik & Rumelli â€“ located 2-3 blocks on side street off of Divan Yolu (Divanyolu Caddesi Ticarethane). Outdoor seating, or sit upstairs which we did (there are several small rooms with fireplaces and 3-4 tables in each room). Good Turkish food and ambience. 3) Adonin Cafe (Located across from Mozaik & Rumelli on Divanyolu Caddesi Ticarethane sokak no:27/31) www.adonincafe.com Again, we enjoyed excellent Turkish cuisine, including the best lentil soup Iâ€™ve ever had, and Turkish â€œravioliâ€� with a lamb sauce. The service was excellent, and the staff were so friendly to our international mix of diners from Australia and Chicago. Remember that many places have rooftop views, so ask at the hotel for recommendations on where to go for a rooftop view of Istanbul. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “very botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: maulu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really the best solution for a stay in Istanbul : clean,quite,central location, perfect buffet breakfast and the staff is very very kind. Also the pub/restaurant is a very good choice to eat some turkish plate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ellencmog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from two weeks in Turkey. We spent six nights at the Faros Hotel. I spent hours researching Istanbul hotels before we left, and booked the Faros based on its location and reviews. The location couldn't be better. It's a five-minute walk to Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, and the Basilica Cistern. The Grand Bazaar and Topkapi are a 10-minute walk. We used the light rail a lot and the Sultanahmet stop was just down the street. Our room was spacious by European standards and the bathroom was modern and large. Our room looked out on Divan Yolu, one of the main streets of the area. I loved the sound of the tram and the hustle and bustle of city life below us, but with the window closed at night, it was very quiet. The staff couldn't have been nicer. My husband's suitcase never arrived, and they went out of their way to suggest places we could shop for clothes. Their breakfast (included in the price of the room) is delicious as was dinner. We saw Turkish diners in the restaurant almost every day which is always a good sign. They arranged transportation to the airport when we left. We would definitely return to the Faros!

Reviews.Title: “You MUST stay here”
Reviews.Author: Traveller-DJP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent from every point of view. The management and staff are warm, welcoming, and efficient. Nothing's any trouble. The rooms are good and the cleanliness is top-class. The location is exceptional since you can easily walk to all the main attractions in the Sulmanhamet area. Also you can take the tram from outside the hotel, across the city to see many other attractions. Indeed the tram trip is a feast of the eye. I suggest that, at the outset of your stay, you take the open-top tour bus trip around the city in order to get acquainted. After a hard day's sightseeing, boating, shopping etc it's good to be able to relax in the bar/restaurant where you will be well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ,Excellent Services and Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: PC4YOU
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last year and this time was second time to stay there. We were very happy last year with the services, location and managements. We booked the Hotel directly from the new manager. He did a big favour to us and he offers us a big room same value of the small room. He also arrange for free transfer from and to air port. Easy access to tourist sites and a great hotel to have if you want to stay for a short time or long time like us for 13 nights. The breakfast was very good for a European hotel. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and Again Sofia and ten minutes from the Grand Bazaar. All staff is very friendly, helpful and polite. Many thanks to all the waiters and the bar staff who worked hard, and made you feel welcome. On the side of hotel there are few restaurants and water pip place with the live music which we never ever forget this holiday. I will recommend to all my family and friends. This will be the only hotel that I will stay in on my future visits to Istanbul. Many thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “The Fabulous Faros Hotel, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Heuy
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Faros Hotel, Istanbul as a fantastic place to stay in central Sultanahmet. The Manager, Haluk was helpful before we even left Australia organising pickups and hire cars for us and making sure that everything was in place before we arrived. The hotel staff were brilliant and went out of their way to help with all aspects of our stay and as a bonus they all have a wonderful sense of humour and great english. The Hotel facilities are of a very high standard and the rooms are well appointed and very comfortable and affordable. The Hotel is situated in a vibrant area within a 5 min stroll to the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazzar and all of Sultanahmet attractions are easily accessible on foot from there. We stayed 3 nights at the start of our holiday and returned for another 2 nights at the end, we were welcomed back like old friends and treated to an upgrade to suites for all three couples! Loved Istanbul and our new Turkish friends at the Faros Hotel. Will definitely go back..

Reviews.Title: “220 Euros a night is not what i call value”
Reviews.Author: Noddy54
Reviews.Content: Only a short walking distance to the Blue Mosque, and Boy did we know it, we landed right in the middle of Ramadan. The Noise was incredible and no let up untill late into the night or should i say early hours of the Morning. That aside, the Hotel from the street is rather a non event, but having checked in we found the front counter helpful and efficient. The rooms are not large but were generaly clean, its one of the few hotels by the way that didnt ask for money for packet coffee. We did a two day trip to Galipoli and Troy and i was pleased that the hotel was prepared to securley lock up our suitcases for us to retrieve later. The chef who cooked the Morning breakfast was anxious to please and although basic was quite well prepared. The shock was the room rate 220 Euros a night and 19 Euros for Breakfast, now i am quite happy to give this hotel a 3 star rating But thats not what i call value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “It is in there, right in the middle of the action/sights”
Reviews.Author: PortPowerW
Reviews.Content: I am taking the time to compliment the staff and management of the Faros Hotel in Istanbul, Turkey as they did an outstanding job. They made one feel important and special although we were holiday makers from Australia we appreciated the help and service provided by them. The location was special for a first timer to Istanbul, close to the Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. Although it was only a 4 day stopover it was certainly excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Safety Alert For Unaccompanied Female Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Toomuch26
Reviews.Content: The Faros Hotel is conveniently located on the Tram line and directly across from central attractions such as the Blue Mosque. The staff of the Faros are friendly and attentive with ready advice on local attractions and dinner recommendations. Females traveling without male escort should take care when travelling to Turkey; a tour group might be more enjoyable. Additionally, while staying at the Faros, someone attempted to gain access to our room in the middle of the night: whether staff or management we know not. Luckily, the chain was on, but unaccompanied female travelers are little more than prey in Istanbul and unfortunately, this extended into the hotel as well. Women beware. www.faroshotelistanbul.com

Reviews.Title: “A cosy hotel with a central location”
Reviews.Author: LauMilano
Reviews.Content: A perfect location right in Sultanhamet, the historic heart of Istanbul, within walking distance from the main attractions. The rooms are clean, nice and warm. Hotel has a lively cafe/restaurant serving drinks and food at reasonable prices. Helpful and gentle staff always ready to give you some hints.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: awesometraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really close to a lot of the sites. Because of the small size of the hotel, the staff really helped and got to know us. The waiters especially in the restaurant were really fun and joked around. The rooms were also nice and clean. Some rooms are a little small, but still really nice and clean. Also try the restaurant, it is really convenient and delicious. I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous”
Reviews.Author: BLEUWAVE
Reviews.Content: This was one of our most amazing trips. Thanks to Faros for making our holiday so special. We were expecting an average service/facility, but Faros far exceeded our expectations. The hotel manager & his staff were extremly friendly. The hotel is centrally located with lots of cafes & restaurants in its vicinity. Rooms were very clean & tidy. I would highly recommend this lovely boutique hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul on a leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and motel”
Reviews.Author: Birdwing62
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the motel. It is within easy walkingto all he main attractions. Rooms a clean and spaceous. The breakfast which is served in the restaruant was very good. The menu was hard to choose from with so many great meals on offer, Stayed for 3 nights, it is a shame it wasn't longer. I was even able to catch up with my emails, using there free wireless internet connection in the room. Would definitly suggest a stay here. The staff were helpful when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing!!! (Literally).”
Reviews.Author: LadyBManchester
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really well located if you're wanting to stay in the old town and it's within 30 seconds walk of the tram which provides access to the airport and other parts of the city - we found it very useful. We stayed in the standard room on the top (4th) floor facing the inner courtyard. It was pretty quiet (aside from the calling from the mosques which you'll hear from any hotel in the old town) and the room was a reasonable standard, generally. Breakfast was fine and plentiful - it was provided in the bar downstairs and beers in the bar were reasonably priced for Istanbul. The front desk were useless. They couldn't provide any information on getting around the city etc etc and dealt with a major issue we had with our room totally unsatisfactorily. The glass shower screen in our room came off its hinges and shattered over both of us, showering us in tiny shards of glass but causing thankfully only minor cuts. This happened one morning before breakfast and we reported it to reception who were slow to respond. They did not offer us an alternative room to use or show any concern given the damage it had caused, which was very poor service. When we returned to the room in the evening we expected the screen to have been replaced but all they had done was sweep up the glass (badly)! So we kept cutting ourselves. Thankfully we left the next morning and we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Lufcdeano
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Faros for one night before leaving the country the next day, my friends contacts, price and location decided my stay here. The location of the hotel is perfect, the taxiride to airport takes app. 20 mins(~20 euros/ 38 liras), Faros is also close to Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, and tramline. I was happy to find a waterboiler with complimentary coffee&tea, plus a bottle of water. Also the way of decorating the room satisfied my eye, there is also airconditioner which might be handy in summer, but this time it wasnt needed. My room was quiet due to facing the inner yard, sadly i didnt have too much time to enjoy of the balcony i had available. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and the selection of the food was more than satisfying, even after most of the other guests had had their breakfast before me.

Reviews.Title: “small friendly hotel in ideal spot for sightseeing in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: wickedstepmother
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff at the Hotel Faros. The room was very clean and had tea and coffee making facilities. Good choice at breakfast and restaurant in the evenings. The location was ideal , within walking distance of many of the sights and other restaurants if you didn't want to eat in. The shower cubicle in our bedroom was a bit of a tight squeeze but OK for a a short stay. Drinks, tea, coffee, soft drinks and wine are very expensive in Istanbul e.g. Â£3.50 for coffee and Â£4 for a glass of wine. Whereas eating out is comparable to the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: Jerabelle
Reviews.Content: My family and I went for my daughter's wedding. Everything about the hotel was great - it was spotless, the staff were friendly, considerate and very helpful. The hotel is also well placed for visiting most of the tourist sites. Trams very handy.

Reviews.Title: “A very average hotel - not a 4 star for sure”
Reviews.Author: TulliM
Reviews.Content: Only stay at this hotel if you've got very little time in Istanbul and just want to be near the tourist sites. Otherwise this area is too touristy, with very average restaurants. The room itself was much smaller than in the pictures, though very adequately furnished. The biggest problem was the toilet type smell when you entered the room - i guess this was because the exhaust fan switches offf when you lock the room door. pretty bad!! the reception staff was generally quite useless..didnt know about restaurants in the area or other amenities we asked them about. all in all, i would only stay for a very short time, if i was getting a good price only.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: SagaLoutLondon
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a week-end at the Faros with 8 friends. We were all very impressed. The staff were efficient, helpful and great fun. The food was very good and reasonably priced. We would all stay there again if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely weekend”
Reviews.Author: craddocksue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Faros for 4 nights is January. Istanbul was very cold, but we had a very warm welcome from the staff at this hotel. The pictures on the web sites show the premium rooms and not the standard rooms, but all the rooms where very clean, nice and warm. People have complained about the noise of this hotel, we did not find that a problem as we where right at the top of the hotel but our friends who had one of the premium rooms where above the front door and complained about the door opening and closing through the night (they need a door silencer). The staff are lovely and speak really good English the food is great and the service is good. There is a huge choice from the breakfast buffet and also a couple of warm dishes and the one thing I really liked was you were not rushed so if you wanted to sit there an hour drinking more coffee and helping yourself you could. Food is comparable to London prices but alcohol is very expensive there and kept bumping up our food bill a lot. The Hotel is located in a great position, where you can walk to all the sites. I would really recommend visiting the Basilica Cistern , and spend Â½ a day at Topkapi Palace its amazing, I was not keen on the Grand Bazaar and the blue Mosque was lovely but only spent an hour there. I would recommend this hotel as we loved the staff and the food was great and you are in such a central position. Credit to the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Small, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: drteeth47
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the old part of Istanbul-excellent location to all the sites(blue mosque, grand bazarre,etc) Rooms are small but adequate. the breakfast was good and the staff was helpful. I would recommend this hotel since it is small and located in the right area for touring. RW from New York area

Reviews.Title: “Very central but not 4-star as it says!”
Reviews.Author: B_in_London
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Istanbul was meant to be a romantic birthday getaway, so we were looking for a boutique 4-5 star hotel right in the old town. Faros Hotel is certainly central, and quite charming. But 4 star it is not. The rooms are clean and functional, although a little noisy from the street and the tram line which runs past the hotel. We would recommend it to travellers though. For a little more luxury head to the Four Seasons. Across the road from the Four Seasons is a fabulous fish restaurant on top of the Seven Hills Hotel. Its right between the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque and you get the most amazing view as well as hearing the mosques 'singing' to each other at about 8pm.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! (clean, well located, friendly staff great food)”
Reviews.Author: JorMolchan
Reviews.Content: We spent a full week at the Faros. The rooms look just like the photos; clean and even large for a European hotel with very tall windows giving the feel of a small balcony. The beds were comfortable. There is an elevator. The hotel is located close to the Blue Mosque, Haya Sofya, Grand Bazaar, the Cistern, Cemberlitas Hamam and Topkapi Palace. The metro is out front but couldn't be heard thru the windows. The call to prayer could faintly be heard when the city was quiet, but wouldn't wake you. Though we usually eat away from hotels we enjoyed several very nice dinners plus daily brkfst at the hotel. The patio offered great people watching as locals rushed to school or work and tourists came and went. The staff were all very friendly. They spoke perfect English and eagerly welcomed our attempts at speaking Turkish. The best word they taught us was "harika" (wonderful). The hotel and people indeed were harika. We very highly recommend the Faros Hotel Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “a great find”
Reviews.Author: pialligo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was suggested and booked by our travel agent. We had stayed at another hotel in the city, and we did not like the location or the attitude of the staff there. However, when we arrived at the Faros Hotel we were impressed. It is not glamorous, but is in a great location, close to transport, and within easy walking distance of most of the major tourist attractions in Istanbul ( the 2 big mosques, Haghia Sophia and Sultanahmet, the cistern, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar) and with many cafes and restaurants to choose from nearby. There are only 4 floors, with 6 rooms on each floor. Ours was no. 405, and we had a bedroom, good sized bathroom with a great shower, a little balcony with a view to the water, and even tea and coffee making facilities! Everything was very clean, and the staff were most helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included in the tariff, which was very reasonable, and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PCINHANTS
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Faros - after checking out the reviews on Tripadvisor. The reviews turned out to reflect our experience. The hotel is ideally placed for first time Istanbul visitors, within walking distance of many of the most popular sights. The tram service from 100m down the road is excellent and easy to use. It was easy to get to and from the airport (Ataturk) by metro and tram. The hotel is very recently refurbished and very clean. Despite being on a fairly busy road the double glazing is excellent making it very quiet inside. Rooms not huge, but we've certainly stayed in smaller. Staff are very helpful, and breakfast was good and plentiful. We'd certainly stay here if we went to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: DiannaD
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the Faros Hotel from late December to early January, 2008. Our family had two suites and one double room for our stay. All three rooms were modern, very comfortably furnished and absolutley clean. They do look like the pictures. The suites are corner rooms on the first three floors. We had the ones on first and second floor and initially we had some concern about how quiet they would be because of all the street traffic and the restaurant directly under the first floor room. Noise was not a problem. The breakfast was very good with a large selection every morning. We found all of the people who worked in the hotel and restaurant were friendly and helpful. The restaurant was also a popular place for dinner. The location was the best. We could walk to many of the sites. The tram that stops across the street was very easy to use. As we walked around Sulthanamet, I recognized the names of some of the hotels I had read about when researching where to stay. Some were in quieter areas but I still liked ours better because of the location and friendliness of the employees.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid, Spain”
Reviews.Author: MadridRuth
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights last November. It's very well located, just two minutes walking from main atractions in Sulthanamet. The room was modern, clean and charming. It's surrounded of many restaurants and you have a tranv station in front of the hotel. We recomend Faros Hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Silverpablito
Reviews.Content: This is a nice modern hotel in the centre of Sultanahmet and ideally located for all the major tourist attractions that are just a few minutes walk away. You can get a taxi to the hotel from the airport for about Â£12. Quite a journey. About 50 mph, 5 feet from the back of the car in front. Almost as good as a rollercoaster ride. Alternatively, you can get the Metro and change to the tram (1.30 Turkish Lira each) and get off the tram at Sultanahmet station. The hotel is about 200 yards away, back the way you have just come on the tram, on the right. Breakfast is juice, coffee, egg and sausage, cereal, dried fruit, fruit, bread, croissant, cheese,, cold meat etc. and great for a few days. The Sultanahmet area is very touristy and there are loads of restaurants in the area. You will be pestered all day by people trying to get you in their bar or restaurant for coffee or a meal. We found all the restaurants pretty mediocre. The main sites are really worth seeing. If you hoped to see the Turkish east meets west, you are about twenty years too late. The whole of Istanbul is pretty westernised now and quite expensive. Eating out is not cheap. Food is a bit cheaper than England but alcohol is expensive. Beer Â£4.50 a pint and wine is Â£15-20 a bottle. If you go over to the Golden Horn and Beyoglu there is more night life and the restaurants are better. It is even more westernised though. The main street could be any British High Street, with Top Shop, Gap, three Starbucks, two McDonalds and a Burger King. Try one of the restaurants at the bottom of the main street, Istiklal Caddesi. Turn off right just after the Swedish Embassy. Try meze as a starter, followed by fish, but don't expect any change from 100 TL and it will be more if you have wine. To get to the horn from Sultanahmet, jump on the tram and get off at Tophane and then just keep walking up the hill to the top. If you do want a really cheap lunch one day, go down to Ataturk bridge (on the tram) and you will see all the locals eating grilled mackeral with onion or salad in a chunk of bread. 3 TL and delicious!

HotelInfo.Name: Faros Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Divan Yolu 76 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34110, Turkey
